docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 9. -- Business conditions remain generally unfavorable in our markets abroad covered in the current weekly survey by the Commerce Department. Some improvements were reported, however, from Canada, China and the Philippines.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 9. -- Business conditions remain generally unfavorable in our markets abroad covered in the current weekly survey by the Commerce Department. Some improvements were reported, however, from Canada, China and the Philippines.

headline.main: FEW HOPEFUL SIGNS IN FOREIGN TRADE; Trend in South America Is Down or Unimproved, Commerce Bureau Survey Shows. SEASONAL RISE IN CANADA Retail Sales Are "Fairly Good" -- Britain Reports Slight Declines, but Italy Has Some Gains.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: GENEVA. ARE international matters solely the province of men, or do they also fall within the woman's sphere? Do the women of the world have any voice in them at the present time? How can they exert such influence in the future?

headline.main: Rebellion Breaks Out in Brazilian Army; Uruguay Hears of Its Success in Sao Paulo

byline.original: Special Cable to The Chicago Tribune

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 11. -- Conflicting and highly censored news reaching here tonight from Southern Brazil indicates the Sau Paulo revolt is more serious than is admitted in the Rio de Janeiro Government's official statements.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 11. -- Conflicting and highly censored news reaching here tonight from Southern Brazil indicates the Sau Paulo revolt is more serious than is admitted in the Rio de Janeiro Government's official statements.
docs.abstract: Revolt spreading; map; cadets called; drafting of Constitution ordered; all ports in Sao Paulo State ordered closed; regime of Pres Vargas related

headline.main: REVOLT IN BRAZIL REPORTED SPREADING; Uruguay Hears Four or More States Have Joined Rising Led by Sao Paulo. FEDERALS CLAIM VICTORY Announce Recapture of Itarare, Which Is Outside Area They Admit Is Affected. CADETS CALLED TO COLORS Telegraph Lines Are Seized In South -- All Furloughs Canceled -- Port of Santos Closed.

headline.main: Uruguay Severs Relations With Argentina Over Charge of Warship Harboring an Exile

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 14 -- Assis Brasil, the Brazilian Ambassador, formally offered to the Argentine Foreign Minister today Brazil's good offices to bring about a renewal of diplomatic relations between Argentina and Uruguay.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 14 -- Assis Brasil, the Brazilian Ambassador, formally offered to the Argentine Foreign Minister today Brazil's good offices to bring about a renewal of diplomatic relations between Argentina and Uruguay.
docs.abstract: Brazil offers to mediate; people show little interest in rift; Uruguayan Cong notified

headline.main: OFFER OF MEDIATION MADE TO ARGENTINA; Brazil Proffers Good Offices After Uruguay Severs Diplomatic Relations. OTHER EFFORTS CALLED OFF Peoples of Countries Concerned Show Little Interest -- We Take Over Uruguay's Interests.

byline.original: Special cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 15 -- The rupture of diplomatic relations between their countries has brought the people of Argentina and Uruguay closer together than they have been in several years. Newspapers, public men and organizations in each country are...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 15 -- The rupture of diplomatic relations between their countries has brought the people of Argentina and Uruguay closer together than they have been in several years. Newspapers, public men and organizations in each country are trying to outdo one another in expressions of admiration.
docs.abstract: Break draws people together; Uruguayan Cong authorizes memorial to Argentina

headline.main: ARGENTINE HONORS VOTED IN URUGUAY; Congress Authorizes Memorial as Diplomatic Break Draws Peoples Together. RIVALRY IN FRIENDLINESS Buenos Aires Students Visit Capital of Neighboring Country to Seek Means of Closing Rift.
